data.enText: a drink usually made from a mixture of one or more spirits (= strong alcoholic drinks) and fruit juice. It can also be made without alcohol.

data.chText: 鸡尾酒酒吧 / 陈列柜 / 酒吧间

data.enText: a dish of small pieces of food, usually served cold

data.chText: （常指掺合不太相容的）混合物
data.enText: a mixture of different substances, usually ones that do not mix together well

means: (常指掺合不太相容的)混合物

tr: an appetizer served as a first course at a meal

value.def: A cocktail is an alcoholic drink which contains several ingredients.

example.ex: On arrival, guests are offered wine or a champagne cocktail...
example.tran: 每位宾客一到场都会有人送上葡萄酒或香槟鸡尾酒。

value.def: A cocktail is a mixture of a number of different things, especially ones that do not go together well.

example.ex: The court was told she had taken a cocktail of drugs and alcohol...
example.tran: 有人在法庭上指称她把毒品和烈酒混在一起喝下去了。

example.ex: Children and guns are a potentially lethal cocktail.
example.tran: 让儿童接触枪支可能会有致命的危险。

value.tran: (尤指不宜搭配在一起的材料构成的)合成物，混合物

trans: (宾馆、饭店或俱乐部供应酒类饮料的)休息室，酒吧间
(通常在正餐前食用的)大虾冷盘
鲜虾盅(正餐前的一道开胃菜)
